result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky A Seymour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ricky A Seymour is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ricky A Seymour was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 fine plus costs. Paid in full.
Stayed. Financial obligations have been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ricky A Seymour
Current: 1079 Shawano Avenue, ATTEMPTED/NOT KNOWN, Green Bay, WI 54303   (Effective: 06-30-2015)
Prior: 1079 Shawano Avenue, Green Bay, WI 54303

Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC, makes sentencing recommendation. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Defendant waives prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Ricky A Seymour in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions how Defendant wants to proceed. State advises of meeting with Defendant, reviews activity from last hearing. Court reviews options of getting an attorney or proceeding without counsel. Defendant wants to proceed. State advises of plea agreement. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily.
Defendant called around 1:00 pm with confirmation number 1924522, payment of remaining $125.
No confirmation of payment of remaining $125 due.

Defendant Ricky A Seymour in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, including letter received from Ms. Henkins requesting her money back. Court questions Defendant on progress with DA. Defendant says it went good. State advises of offer made to Defendant. Discussion regarding return of bond money. Defendant advises that the money is his. Discussion regarding whether Defendant filled out plea questionnaire. Defendant barely checks his mail. Defendant leaves, comes back requesting that he not be convicted of felony. State will not change offer. Defendant did not post bond. Court orders Defendant to pay $400 today, pay remaining $100 within 48 hours.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am. Defendant returns to courtroom, only has $375, is ordered to have remaining $125 paid by 4:30 today.
from Carissa Hinkens requesting bond money be returned

Defendant Ricky A Seymour in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Ricky A Seymour appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/6/15, 10:00.
